name: Strange Gravity
description:
The tagline says it all - a FPS/RTS hybrid about miniature planetoids and fungal spores. It's kinda like that flash game Phage Wars, but in first person and huge. (I've been made aware that there's also a very popular game series called Galcon which is also a similar format!)

I ended up being quite happy with the finished product. I obviously didn't get around to doing everything I wanted to, but I do believe that it's rather fun, with a decent difficulty later on in the game.

There are 11 levels, not including the full museum-style tutorial that I'm quite proud of.

Uploading it as a downloadable .exe for now. The web player didn't want to play nicely with Unity beta 4.6. Also available are UNTESTED Mac and Linux builds. Who knows, they might work perfectly.

Mouse and Keyboard controls.

Inspired by a some design work of Timothy J. Reynolds at

http://www.turnislefthome.com/206637/2191473/3d-wo...

Please let me know if you run into any game-breaking errors! And please let me know if you play it, and whether you enjoyed it or not, and whether you finished it! Much appreciated! Have fun!
